physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a man, sitting on the edge of a rock, on the bottom right of the photograph. He is overlooking a waterbody in the middle of a forested area. The stream is flowing downwards on the left side of the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen on the photograph.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of a man by a stream
subject_terms_1: aerial views natural landscapes streams snapshots
